subject: Re: [junit] Re. GUI testing
msgSnippet: Hi Simon, Joel, ... I might add that it is quite possible to unit test custom components (self-drawn stuff, panels consisting of connected widgets, etc.) as
messageBody:
Hi Simon, Joel,

On 8/16/06, Simon replied to Joel:
> Your GUI developer needs a different tool than JUnit for their GUI testing.

I might add that it is quite possible to unit test custom components
(self-drawn stuff, panels consisting of "connected" widgets, etc.) as
well as drive a full Swing GUI using tools like jfcUnit or Jemmy,
using JUnit as a handy and familiar "runtime" which takes care of
keeping track of test failures and such.

-Lasse-
